1. Tax-loss harvesting: This involves selling securities that have declined in value to offset the gains from other securities. This can help reduce the overall tax liability by offsetting the gains with losses.
2. Wash sale rule: The wash sale rule prohibits investors from buying the same security within 30 days of selling it at a loss. This rule is designed to prevent investors from claiming a loss on a security they have not actually sold.
3. Tax-loss carryover: If an investor has a loss on a security, they can use that loss to offset gains from other securities in the same tax year. If the loss is greater than the gains, the excess loss can be carried over to future tax years.
